item.title: Smells very bad in the surrounding, 1st July
item.description:
Looks like the home owner dumping cat and dog litter in green bin. The green flies are all over the neighbourhood. Bad smell and we can not even pass from that pavement. Is there any department to check into it. As there was one more complain from my other neighbour but no action been taken. The address of that property is 16 Pynham Close, SE2 9QL.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pynham Close, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sorn Car abandoned in my disabled bay, 1st July
item.description:
Sorn Car abandoned in my disabled bay. The car has no blue badge displayed. I am unable to park in my disabled bay due to this car taking the bay.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brickfield Cottages, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large bump, 1st July
item.description:
The road surface seems to have expanded and caused a very sharp section of raised road surface. I almost lost control of my motorcycle and nearly caused a crash. It was bad enough that my back is sore from the impact!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A20, St Mary Cray, Swanley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bags dumped in Shrewsbury Park, 1st July
item.description:
Nine black bags of domestic rubbish smelling badly dumped near the Plum Lane entrance to Shrewsbury Park. Two days after the last lot was kindly removed by Greenwich Council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plum Lane, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge amounts of flipping from Old Kent Road to the Nature Reserve along Cobourg Road, 1st July
item.description:
Unknown items - may be dangerous - kids and the public walk up and down this road, especially during the summer months given the location next to the park. This is dangerous, please remove asap. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cobourg Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small sink hole in road, 1st July
item.description:
A small sink hole has developed near a drain cover - an empty space is visible below a hole in the tarmac - it’s potentially dangerous as coaches frequently park in the location as it is close to the Youth Hostel on Rotherhithe St. I believe it is a new issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 165, Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed vehicle parked in road overnight, 1st July
item.description:
YP03 ZGA is being parked in Rosecroft Close overnight and being used regularly by the same owners as R26 KLM. YP03ZGA is not taxed or MOT. The owner is parking many vehicles in Rosecroft Close and causing problems for elderly residents. Please ask the owner to remove these vehicles that are illegally parked. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Derry Downs, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: West End Lane between Cleve Road and Hemstal Road, 1st July
item.description:
Green light came on for pedestrians to cross West End Lane. I was crossing with my 3 year old son. At the same time a car pulled out of Cleve Road to turn right into the road where we were crossing. Extremely dangerous and we could have been hit.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West End Lane, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangery diseased street tree, 1st July
item.description:
This tree is nearly dead w one large branch overhanging the pavement. If the branch breaks which it is likely to do in windy weather it could fall on someone in this street which has a very busy footfall. Can it be removed please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grierson Road, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mountains of rubbish and rats at 145 Eglinton Road, 1st July
item.description:
This was reported last week but the problem has worsened. There are mountains of rubbish and overflowing black bins outside this property. We as neighbours feel Environmental Health should now become involved. Rats have been seen on top of the many black bags and on the dumped furniture. This has been ongoing for more than two years and as Council Tax payers we are now desperate
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 169, Eglinton Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
